name: Intelligent Orchestration Engine
title: Intelligent Orchestration Engine
description: Core logic for autonomous task decomposition, cascaded context retrieval, and memory promotion.

axiomAlignment.A1_verifiability: Decision routing is traceable via orchestration logs.
axiomAlignment.A2_user_primacy: The user can intercept and override autonomous routing decisions.
axiomAlignment.A3_transparency: The routing decision matrix is publicly defined in the catalog.
axiomAlignment.A4_non_harm: Tool limits are strictly enforced based on agent staffing roles.
axiomAlignment.A5_consistency: Routing follows a deterministic cascaded strategy (Local -> RAG -> Web).

cascaded_context_routing.description: Priority-based context gathering from Knowledge Graph, local RAG library, and external Web search.
cascaded_context_routing.use_when: When an agent needs the most accurate context with minimum latency.
cascaded_context_routing.code_example: # cascading logic implemented in research workflow via orchestration-engine.json registry entries
best_practices: Always use authorized MCP tools listed in agent-staffing.json.
Promote session findings to knowledge base only after walkthrough verification.
Regularly audit the staffing registry to ensure least-privilege tool access.
Implement fallback mechanisms for all orchestration steps.
anti_patterns: Hard-coding tool access outside of the staffing registry.
Attempting web search before exhausting local knowledge repositories.
